description: {"blocks":[{"key":"74miu","text":"Reagents - ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hpu5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7r3e","text":"Basic cell culture media: respective to the cell line used and experimental design ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qd1","text":"Distilled water: Invitrogen® UltraPure™ Distilled Water (catalog number 19977015) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjrmk","text":"Highthroughput (HT) Pro A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":60,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cei1i","text":"96-well collection plate: USA scientific® TempPlate non-skirted 96-well PCR plate natural (catalog number 1402-9596) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6amqa","text":"QIAquick™ PCR purification kit (Qiagen®; catalog number 28104) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":31,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e572k","text":"Hypotonic Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14nra","text":"Digestion Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":17,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2aql7","text":"Lysis Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a75t","text":"Column Conditioning Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":27,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1b3h","text":"or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqvjq","text":"Wash Buffer 1 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":14,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kgr6","text":"Wash Buffer 2 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":14,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j2of","text":"Wash Buffer 3 (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":14,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1akh0","text":"Elution Buffer (Chromatrap® HT ChIP-qPCR kit; catalog number 500161 or 500162 or 500163)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":15,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7n7c","text":"5M NaCl: dissolve 292g of NaCl in 800mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 1L with H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":44,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":78,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44a89","text":"1M NaHCO3: dissolve 12.6g of NaHCO3 in 100 mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 150 mL with H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"bold"},{"offset":8,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":34,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":50,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":88,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b5ed","text":"Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC): Cell signaling Technology® (catalog number 5871) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":33,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53pvn","text":"Proteinase K: Qiagen® (catalog number 19133) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93ria","text":"Proteinase K stop solution: 100mM Phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride (PMSF). Weigh 1.742g PMSF (Sigma-Aldrich®, catalog number 10837091001) and add DMSO (Sigma-Aldrich®, catalog number D2650) to a final volume of 100mL. Dissolve completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":28,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a18o","text":"PBS: HyClone™ Phosphate Buffered Saline (1X) (catalog number SH30256.01) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":5,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g6s9","text":"Formaldehyde: VWR® 37% w/w aqueous solution (catalog number 97064-604) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6uv1","text":"0.65M Glycine: Dissolve 488g of glycine into 1L of H2O to make 6.5M glycine (10X). Dilute with PBS to make 1X before each experiment.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"},{"offset":52,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99o2b","text":"Micrococcal Nuclease: Cell Signaling Technologies® (catalog number 10011S) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":20,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kve2","text":"1.3-1.5% Agarose gel: dissolve 1.3-1.5g of agarose powder into 100mL of TAE buffer by microwave heating. Visualize DNA under UV light by adding appropriate amount of Ethidium Bromide, or use an equivalent method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":20,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"563ec","text":"Add appropriate amount of Ethidium Bromide to cooled down gel solution to visualize DNA under UV light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8007","text":"0.5M EDTA: Dissolve 186.1g EDTA into 700mL of H2O. Adjust the volume to 1L with H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"bold"},{"offset":47,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":81,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"197gv","text":"100bp ladder: NEB® (catalog number N0467S) or equivalent product from other vendor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":12,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97oa","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"780no","text":"Materials -","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpc93","text":"Heat block","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f24f9","text":"Rotator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59id9","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b21hc","text":"Microcentrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj6l6","text":"37ºC incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da33p","text":"Nanodrop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jk84","text":"Sonicator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8orj5","text":"UV light imager","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e839e","text":"Rocking platform","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i3gs","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ae4ds","text":"Culture between 1-15 million cells. Collect cells by spinning down at 500xg at 4\u00baC for 5 minutes. Wash cells with PBS at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8brk0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19315","duration":"300","label":"","guid":"B8D247F0822B420596AEABC864442AA7"}}],"guid":"59227238E7694ED9B2061EFC0F3F0364","id":664034,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6b3uc","text":"Remove the PBS and add freshly made basic cell culture media (it should not contain any serum or large molecular weight proteins to avoid any interferences from those proteins) containing 1% formaldehyde (CH2O) to cross-link the DNA-protein complexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":207,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"31BA418EBCF141648BAF6E27F68FB418","id":664035,"previous_id":664034,"previous_guid":"59227238E7694ED9B2061EFC0F3F0364","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7cm7","text":"Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature with gentle agitation on a rocking platform. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6v2k1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19316","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"1A9501D2B4B24C65902C938ABD059916"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jcr5","text":"Remove the fixation solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4\u00baC for 5 minutes. To quench there action, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 3mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 4mL of 0.65M glycine solution; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 5mL of 0.65M glycine solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"53h24","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19317","duration":"300","label":"","guid":"E1309BC4FEC849A5BB609802F1DB7D59"}}],"guid":"F353DAF7FFC74A188FB6F806FED3821D","id":664037,"previous_id":664036,"previous_guid":"4EEBAEEBA6924A1286B37649C629194B","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co9r","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes with gentle agitation on a rocking platform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9c38u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"657hg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6fm5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"E94E6D30B78311E8B02A8532FCCD41F4","duration":300,"label":"","step_guid":"A274D36D12A7458A8C39968EC2B63C39"}}],"guid":"A274D36D12A7458A8C39968EC2B63C39","id":664038,"previous_id":664037,"previous_guid":"F353DAF7FFC74A188FB6F806FED3821D","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1i86f","text":"Remove the glycine solution by spinning down at 500xg at 4\u00baC for 5 minutes. Discard the supernatant. The pellet can be frozen at -80\u00baC after adding 1\u00b5L of Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54mfh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19318","duration":"300","label":"","guid":"756D060D16444C7CA6229E31B2E8BAB5"}}],"guid":"BB8C86B133F74A1794621B9918FF90FF","id":664039,"previous_id":664038,"previous_guid":"A274D36D12A7458A8C39968EC2B63C39","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceda3","text":"To lyse the cells, for cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.4mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.8mL of Hypotonic Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 1mL of Hypotonic Buffer to the cell pellet. Resuspend the cells and incubate at 4\u00baC for 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7pbg8","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19319","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"0501DC14E5124086A994DE0850021F77"}}],"guid":"ED53542AF9574DD5974D35E0034046DB","id":664040,"previous_id":664039,"previous_guid":"BB8C86B133F74A1794621B9918FF90FF","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2mon","text":"Centrifuge the hypotonic slurries at 5,000xg at 4\u00baC for 5 minutes to collect the nuclei. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"lju4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19320","duration":"300","label":"","guid":"0187D8CB4D154B66AAAD8608F8C33299"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uiue","text":"For cell count of 1-5 million, add 0.3mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 5-10 million, add 0.4mL of Digestion Buffer; for cell count of 10-15 million, add 0.5mL of Digestion Buffer to the nuclei, immediately followed by adding 2\u00b5L of PIC to each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24tma","text":"Add Micrococcal Nuclease to each sample to digest the DNA. Mix by inverting the tube several times and incubate at 37\u00baC for 20 minutes. Mix by inversion every 3-5 minutes. The amount and incubation time of Micrococcal Nuclease required to digest the genomic DNA to an optimal 150 900 bp length may need to be determined empirically for individual cell types.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edsj9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19321","duration":"1200","label":"","guid":"9DC9F35FE4914315A0B79AAE69A62ECC"}}],"guid":"7D48AF196FE34C34807D2DFE451CE3A2","id":664043,"previous_id":664042,"previous_guid":"C079197B3AFD4D82AD66DE975D9E69CB","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7agq9","text":"Stop digestion by adding 10\u00b5L of 0.5M EDTA per sample and place the sample on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e8p","text":"Pellet nuclei by centrifugation at 12,000xg at 4\u00baC for 1 minute. Discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aelhr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19322","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"9FE9ED51472F40648C4EAD36565EFAAE"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmliq","text":"Resuspend nuclear pellet in Lysis Buffer and incubate the sample on ice for 10 minutes to lyse the nuclei. Alternatively, sonicate to shear the DNA. The time and strength for sonication may need to be determined empirically.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fl5r","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19323","duration":"600","label":"","guid":"065C2CFACEB14258A19E1DC75C16F046"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"231bg","text":"Centrifuge the sample at 16,000xg at 4\u00baC for 10 minutes. Transfer the supernatant to a clean dry microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"34nf9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"82vae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"FA896FF0B78311E8B02A8532FCCD41F4","duration":600,"label":"","step_guid":"7C58B4EC2E714969990AA971831AA4A4"}}],"guid":"7C58B4EC2E714969990AA971831AA4A4","id":664047,"previous_id":664046,"previous_guid":"E8B7DFCA45C94D81946D543E452458CA","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2j278","text":"Add 1\u00b5L of PIC to each sample and mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l6ue","text":"Chromatin sample is now ready for ChIP Assay. If the sample is not to be used immediately, store at -80\u00baC. It is recommended that the shearing efficiency is analyzed at this stage to ensurethat 150-900bp fragments are obtained during shearing the DNA to increase the ChIP efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"874414CB6B024D33BDBAAA9069313962","id":664049,"previous_id":664048,"previous_guid":"07026355C7D8438284A299169E3A3CAE","section":"Chromatin Sample Preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qnsi","text":"Take 50\u00b5L aliquot of sheared chromatin from each sample into a new microcentrifuge. Add 5\u00b5Lof 1M NaHCO3, 5\u00b5L of 5M NaCl and 50\u00b5L of Distilled Water. Mix thoroughly and incubate at 65\u00baC (heat block) for two hours or incubation can be extended for overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":102,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1v9g7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19324","duration":"7200","label":"","guid":"16E8D06C4C7D4A1EBCE42D3F33907CB0"}}],"guid":"5355FCE6AC4B4CFCA5FFEE50C2BD8322","id":664050,"previous_id":664049,"previous_guid":"874414CB6B024D33BDBAAA9069313962","section":"Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ijm2","text":"Remove the sample from heat block, add 1\u00b5L of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a spin down at 500xg at 4\u00baC for 5 minutes. Incubate at 37\u00baC for one hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d286j","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19325","duration":"3600","label":"","guid":"CC5DB70AE4C64D2B8EAFE19AE749A04F"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hb0h","text":"Add 2\u00b5L of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"94603099278F440184117D8111BFA5BE","id":664052,"previous_id":664051,"previous_guid":"9DB810CFC1DB45CE9806FB2008E27C48","section":"Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63eu5","text":"Purify the DNA by QIAquick\u2122 PCR purification kit, according to manufacturer\u2019s manual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s7j2","text":"Quantify the DNA in the sample using a Nanodrop. This will be used to determine the volume of chromatin to load in ChIP assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E7F235D4ED404F9EB4D44E05FF48E562","id":664054,"previous_id":664053,"previous_guid":"3BF05FD847484487A700E14976EDBC5E","section":"Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anbch","text":"To ensure 150-900bp fragments have been obtained during shearing the DNA, run each DNA sample on a 1.3-1.5% agarose gel and visualize against a marker of known size DNA fragments (e.g., 100bp ladder).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9B76C9E35FFC413E98A08E9EBB8AA480","id":664055,"previous_id":664054,"previous_guid":"E7F235D4ED404F9EB4D44E05FF48E562","section":"Addendum: Shearing Efficiency Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54sgr","text":"Mix the Chromatin Sample, Protease Inhibitor Cocktail (PIC), optimal quantity of BioLegend\u2019s Go-ChIP-Grade\u2122 Purified antibodies and add Column Conditioning Buffer to make final 1mL slurries. Gently rotate at 4\u00baC for one hour or incubation can also be extended to overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3pose","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bl6j8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"0A3D3670B78411E8B02A8532FCCD41F4","duration":3600,"label":"","step_guid":"6BFBD516FA6548898DB35C9DD3870F4A"}}],"guid":"6BFBD516FA6548898DB35C9DD3870F4A","id":664056,"previous_id":664055,"previous_guid":"9B76C9E35FFC413E98A08E9EBB8AA480","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g48q","text":"Prepare the high-throughput (HT) Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column by adding 600\u00b5L of Column Conditioning Buffer in each well or column and allow it to flow through via gravity (~15 minutes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5preh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19326","duration":"900","label":"","guid":"582EF8A17C7B414EAF02842EAE0A35D8"}}],"guid":"278AE17726474E09810EFB824C717DC2","id":664057,"previous_id":664056,"previous_guid":"6BFBD516FA6548898DB35C9DD3870F4A","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6a5bk","text":"Discard the flow-through and repeat steps 24 and 25.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"00928D4DA6C24729BACB6B02FEDA1E81","id":664058,"previous_id":664057,"previous_guid":"278AE17726474E09810EFB824C717DC2","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qsdp","text":"Remove the slurries from the rotator following 4\u00baC incubation and briefly spin down to remove residual liquid from the caps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6slrj","text":"Load the entire 1mL slurries and allow to flow completely through the high-throughput (HT) Protein A or G 96 well plate or Spin Column at room temperature (approximate 15-20 minutes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"s8fr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19327","duration":"1200","label":"","guid":"D238D53E325343FEBBBE7F3C078C63CB"}}],"guid":"7B165BBF684C48F38519D643D3AC4CA8","id":664060,"previous_id":664059,"previous_guid":"70853133A95549998DC7000C5B334047","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6d465","text":"Add 600\u00b5L of Wash Buffer 1 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xg for column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8r1m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19328","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"1EA2D9D7BC4C4D549C0BA8114FF40120"}}],"guid":"474B948BF4B94B52AFE0C8C5ECA1A7B5","id":664061,"previous_id":664060,"previous_guid":"7B165BBF684C48F38519D643D3AC4CA8","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qnma","text":"Add 600\u00b5L of Wash Buffer 2 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xg for column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"343c3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19329","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"5AC6D7DBD28941AEA24E88A52712CCA1"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fdvj","text":"Add 600\u00b5L of Wash Buffer 3 to each well or column and centrifuge at 2000xg for plate, or 4000xg for column, for one minute at room temperature. Discard the flow through and repeat once. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"42nk7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19330","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"792A923A2FAD4A759697E0F0034EBD96"}}],"guid":"E6163930A2B14D9D9CC5643896F567FE","id":664063,"previous_id":664062,"previous_guid":"77BFEA159872455C8051F8478CB31015","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dmjl","text":"Spin dry at 4,000xg for the plate or 16,000xg for the column for one minute at room temperature to remove any remaining liquid from the membrane of the plate or column. Place a clean 96 well collection plate or a collection tube beneath the plate or column.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6j7u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19331","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"684064FAE5B14EAA9E9F7E8DDF1F7C51"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cio8u","text":"Add 50\u00b5L of Elution Buffer to each well or column. Incubate at room temperature for 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cno0r","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19332","duration":"900","label":"","guid":"CA6041C4315C4B9696D094EA826BE0E5"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqbk1","text":"Centrifuge the plate or column at 4,000xg for the plate, or 16,000xg for the column, for one minute at room temperature to collect the eluted chromatin-protein complex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97di9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19333","duration":"60","label":"","guid":"63D71C7DC4A7471EB907F0CD1B52595A"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c772a","text":"To each eluted sample, add 5\u00b5L of 1M NaHCO3, 5\u00b5L of 5M NaCl and 50\u00b5L of Distilled Water. Mix thoroughly and incubate at 65\u00baC on the heat block for two hours or the incubation time can be extended to overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":42,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dh9ao","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19334","duration":"7200","label":"","guid":"4C828AE4464C477B92547417B46A13F1"}}],"guid":"5D37268B44F74ECEAD8104A06B0E8ADC","id":664067,"previous_id":664066,"previous_guid":"D99581C9768841198937FF6971089242","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ghmp","text":"Remove the sample from the heat block, add 1\u00b5L of Proteinase K to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spin down. Incubate at 37\u00baC for one hour. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5kt4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"19335","duration":"3600","label":"","guid":"96CBEBCD963D4BEE8E13025AE911E6D3"}}],"guid":"8079727CEC5D4FD180E88A615BB298D0","id":664068,"previous_id":664067,"previous_guid":"5D37268B44F74ECEAD8104A06B0E8ADC","section":"Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l87a","text":"Add 2\u00b5L of Proteinase K Stop Solution to each sample, vortex briefly and perform a short spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8injt","text":"Purify the DNA by QIAquick\u2122 PCR purification kit, according to manufacturer\u2019s manual. Purified DNA is ready for downstream real-time qPCR analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
